page.title: 08THE CAMERON BARRACKS
page.content: {THE CAMERON BARRACKS}ARE MADE OF LOCAL SANDSTONE AND MAINLY USED FOR TRAINING SOLDIERS. THE MOUNTAINS AND LOCHS AROUND INVERNESS MAKE AN IDEAL TRAINING GROUND. THERE IS A STAFF OF FIFTY PEOPLE. THE COMMANDING OFFICER IN CHARGE IS ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR BASES AT FORT GEORGE, ST. ANDREWS AND ONE OTHER. HE SUPERVISES SOLDIERS AND CIVILIANS AT THESE BASES. THE {CAMERON {BARRACKS} IS NOT THE HEADQUARTERS FOR ANY PARTICULAR REGIMENT, BUT TRAINS SOLDIERS FROM ALL OVER THE U.K. NEAR THE BARRACKS ARE MARRIED QUARTERS FOR SOLDIERS' FAMILIES. SOME FAMILIES ARE EXPECTED BEFORE THE END OF THE YEAR TO OCCUPY THE HOUSES. A PROBLEM HAS ARISEN OVER THE SAFETY OF THE CHILDREN ON THEIR WAY TO THE LOCAL SCHOOL AT RAIGMORE. TRAFFIC IS HEAVY IN THIS AREA. REGIONAL AND DISTRICT COUNCILS ARE TRYING TO SOLVE THE PROBLEM.
